intro: Spilanthes fimbriata, commonly known as the fringed bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert environments. Spilanthes fimbriata is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
